Pre-Game Insights: Switzerland are set to make a late call on the availability of three players ahead of their Euro 2024 Group A opener against Hungary.
Experienced midfielder Steven Zuber picked up a knock to his calf and was only able to take part in an individual training session, making him a doubt for the clash with Hungary.
Monaco duo Breel Embolo and Denis Zakaria have shaken off injury issues and could be in a position to make the matchday squad on Saturday.
Murat Yakin is set to select a three-man defence including Manchester City's Manuel Akanji.
Captain Granit Xhaka, who won the Bundesliga title with Bayer Leverkusen last season, is expected to start in centre-midfield and could be joined by Remo Freuler.
Silvan Widmer and Dan Ndoye are the most likely duo to operate as wing-backs.
Chicago Fire attacker Xherdan Shaqiri could be joined in the final third by Augsburg's Ruben Vargas and Burnley's Zeki Amdouni.
Noah Okafor, Renato Steffen and Kwadwo Duah are all set to provide cover on the substitutes' bench.
